intro: Randia pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy randia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance.
